page.title: 20OTHER INTERESTING BUILDINGS
page.content: These not owned by Trust Nos.l-5 privately restored.l.THE TRON SHOP- Tron,public weigh-beam,on right.2. SNUFF COTTAGE,l673-Tanhouse Brae, inscription "Wha'wad ha' thocht it" 2nd line of old jingle on snuff- maker's house in Edinburgh-"Noses wad hae bocht it".3.COACHMAN'S COTTAGE l67O. restored l95O.4. THE TANHOUSE l7th cent.Merchants, on de- cline of coal industry,tried tanning, exported shoes to America till Revol- ution in l776. 5.THE HOUSE WITH THE EVIL EYES-because of shape of windows in Dutch gable. THE ABBEY-owner Church of Scotland-founder Malcolm, Earl of Fife,in l2l7.THE CHURCH,C.of S.re- stored l633.Effigies of Sir George Bruce and family, THE ABBEY HOUSE-pro- perty of Countess of Elgin. BLAIR CASTLE-Miner's Convalescent Home DUNIMARLE CASTLE.
